snippet: Mr. Levinson, an ex-F.B.I. agent, disappeared in Iran in 2007. His former colleagues think the U.S. has fallen short in its handling of his case.
abstract: Former New York-based FBI agents Joseph F O’Brien and Andris Kurins discuss misgivings of official investigation regarding colleague Robert A Levinson, who disappeared in 2007 while consulting for the CIA in Iran,  and was last seen alive in 2010 hostage video; pair criticize American government for not doing enough to find out what happened to Levinson, faulting officials for not following up clue in 2007 and omitting him from latest Iranian-American prisoner exchange.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Levinson, an ex-F.B.I. agent, disappeared in Iran in 2007. His former colleagues think the U.S. has fallen short in its handling of his case.

headline.main: Seeking Robert Levinson, the C.I.A. Consultant Who Vanished
headline.print_headline: The Spy Who Never Came Back
